The Hidden Potential of Gemini AI

Features Google Should Promote More

Kenji

AI Unscripted

23

1

L
ooking at the current AI landscape, you might think OpenAI dominates everything. However, Google’s Gemini has quietly built impressive capabilities that deserve more attention.

While OpenAI often gets more attention, I’ve found Gemini offers some genuinely exciting features worth exploring. Here are three standout aspects I’ve experienced and why I think they could significantly impact our daily lives.

1. Gemini Canvas: Creating Without Code Barriers

Imagine being able to build interactive web applications or create detailed guides without writing a single line of code. That’s precisely what Gemini Canvas offers.

The above is a real example of my exploration: I wanted to understand AI agents more deeply but felt overwhelmed by the scattered information. So, I loaded a technical document into Gemini Canvas and asked it to help me create an interactive learning guide.

The result? A beautifully structured study guide webpage with expandable sections covering everything from “AI Safety vs. Responsible AI” to “Trends in AI Agent Design,” complete with styling and interactive card elements that reveal detailed information when clicked.

This isn’t just about convenience — it’s about transforming how we learn and create. I went from drowning in complex information to having a custom-built interactive tool that helped me grasp the concepts quickly.

2. Gemini Deep Research: Your Tireless Research Partner

Another impressive feature is Gemini’s Deep Research, recently upgraded from version 1.5 to 2.0.

This upgrade significantly enhances its research capabilities. It utilizes larger context windows, allowing more profound and accurate insights.

Here’s how it works: You specify a research topic and continue your day. Gemini independently searches various online sources, analyzes the information, and compiles a thorough report.

When finished, you receive a notification — no need to check back continuously.

It’s not just about saving time; this fundamentally changes how we approach complex tasks. The potential for integrating this via API into Gemini apps opens up exciting possibilities for developers to build innovative products.

3. Gemini Personalization: Context When It Matters

The personalization feature in Gemini uses your Google Search history to provide more relevant responses. Unlike the other features, this isn’t something I use constantly — but when I do, the results are impressive.

For example, when I asked for vacation recommendations, Gemini suggested destinations that aligned with places I had previously searched.

This targeted personalization genuinely improves the user experience in specific scenarios where background information matters.

Of course, this requires thoughtful consideration of privacy implications. I’ve found that activating personalization selectively, rather than having it on by default, strikes a good balance between utility and privacy concerns.

What This Means Going Forward

Gemini quietly but powerfully shapes how we create, research, and personalize content. It is crucial to recognize these capabilities and consider their broader implications.

Gemini also offers a vision of a future where AI deeply integrates into our personal and professional lives.
